I also have no clue too ğŸ˜‚
I'm working on my H2s during December
If you need a study buddy or something  I don't mind.
"As much time as you can put in" is a generic answer  but that should be the way
That should not be the ideal way  do enjoy your personal life pls. Studying is not everything
Try to strike a balance between studies and personal time ig
It's alright to study if you want that A  but not at the cost of burning yourself out
i think back then my jc they spent like 6 hours a day around there  and they got like 86 points average
Honestly doubt rp has a perfectly linear relationship with studying time  theres probably a point where it inverts and grinding too hard becomes bad for ur rp (and mental health)
its not perfect  but there must be a threshhold where there is correlation
Understanding the content and asking help from teachers and peers probably helps way more than doing that extra paper
But yes  not studying at all ofc = fail

Taking note of key concepts u dont understand and asking help from others to iron out misconceptions imo is best way to study; bonus is u get to have a life. PS  Remember to note down and file solution along with misconception.No hard and fast rule for studying time  as much as u can to understand and reinforce concepts  while balancing with other aspects of life
thanks guys for all of ur responses !!

Hi guysI need your opinionsMy friend and her friends have enough of their company supervisor  but they don't dare to complain to their lecturer / programme chairTheir company supervisor kept asking them to do an assignment at super last minuteE.g. their supervisor will ask them to do an assignment today and have to submit by tomorrow afternoonAnother example:My friend has written e-logbook and her supervisor has been reading her logbook for 10 weeks already. Her supervisor did not mention anything bad about her e-logbook until yesterday. She has to remove some "unnecessary" pictures from weeks 1 to 10
Do y'all think they should complain to their lecturer / programme chair?
if they rly cant tolerate it then they shld voice out
no point keeping it to themselves

They are afraid to do so as they think that this would just make the matter worseLike if their supervisor know that they complain to their programme chair  they think that their supervisor may purposely torture them even further
So  not sure if they should complain or continue bearing
its up to them whether they want to speak up
if they speak up smth may be done to prevent the supervisor from continuing with his actions but if they dont then they will hv to just bear w it n suffer
